article_node.title: Fears UK heading for 'oblivion' as government borrowing costs soar
article_node.summary: UK 30‑year gilt yields surged to just below 5.7%, the highest level since 1998, after a cabinet reshuffle that sidelined Chancellor Rachel Reeves.  Investors now fear a £50 billion fiscal shortfall and potential tax hikes, pushing the pound lower and the FTSE 100 into a fifth straight red day.  Inflation remains at an 18‑month high and is expected to climb toward 4%, further eroding confidence in the government’s fiscal credibility.
